Package Huffman

Class BitOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • Huffman.BitOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class BitOutputStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A stream where bits can be written to. Because they are written to an underlying byte stream, the end of the stream is padded with 0's up to a multiple of 8 bits. The bits are written in big endian. Mutable and not thread-safe.
    See Also:
    BitInputStream

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BitOutputStream​(java.io.OutputStream out)
      Constructs a bit output stream based on the specified byte output stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitOutputStream

        public BitOutputStream​(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Constructs a bit output stream based on the specified byte output stream.
        Parameters:
        out - the byte output stream
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the output stream is null

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write​(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a bit to the stream. The specified bit must be 0 or 1.
        Parameters:
        b - the bit to write, which must be 0 or 1
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurred

      • close

        public void close​()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this stream and the underlying output stream. If called when this bit stream is not at a byte boundary, then the minimum number of "0" bits (between 0 and 7 of them) are written as padding to reach the next byte boundary.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurred
